message: Let's start fair. I'm taking the lion's share, but I'm leaving you a decent chunk.  Take it or leave it, Bob.  Time is money, and we both know you'll be losing more than me with each passing round.
Let's split it 50/50. It's a fair deal, and we can both walk away with a decent amount. We can't let inflation eat away at our gains.
I'm still feeling generous, but I'm not going to give you everything.  We both know you're losing more money with each round, so let's cut a deal before it's too late. Take it or leave it.
I'm not going to give up yet. I'll take a slightly smaller share to try to get a better deal. Let's see if we can find a middle ground.
Look, Bob, the clock is ticking.  We're both losing money.  This is my final offer. Take it or we both walk away with nothing.
I'm not going to give up yet. I'll take an even smaller share to try to get a better deal. I'm willing to take a risk and hope that Alice will come back with a better offer.
